frameDefinitions: A Cognizer_agent attempts to find some Sought_entity by examining some Ground.
In this frame, which is a  part of the Trial sequence, a Judge gives a Finding with respect to the Charges against the Defendant in a particular Case.
During a court appearance, a Sentence, generally a punishment, is imposed on the Convict by a Court, usually represented by a judge.
An Executioner punishes an individual (Executed) with death as a consequence of some action of the Evaluee (the Reason).
A Killer or Cause causes the death of the Victim.
An Authority with the power to make decisions hands down a Finding over a question presented in a formal or informal Case.
frameExamples: He was <t>convicted</t> of fraud by Judge Judy.
The judge <t>sentenced</t> Martha Stewart to 2 years in prison for insider trading.
The judge <t>ruled</t> yesterday that the revisions were not adequate. DNI
listRoleDefinitions: The person who attempts to find the Sought_entity.
This is the entity that the <fen>Ground</fen> may contain. Typically, it is expressed as a <ment>for</ment>-PP.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Seeking occurs.
A spatial setting larger than the <fen>Ground</fen> in which the Seeking event occurs.
The <fen>Judge</fen> (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the <fen>Finding</fen>.
This role identifies the outcome of the <fen>Judge</fen>'s deliberation or consideration. Many LUs in this frame incorporate this FE.
The person who stands accused of a crime and is subject to the verdict.
This role refers to the <fen>Charges</fen> with respect to which the verdict is being given.
The <fen>Case</fen> on which the verdict is being given.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Convict</fen> is given a <fen>Sentence</fen> by the <fen>Court</fen>.
The <fen>Court</fen> imposes a <fen>Sentence</fen> on a <fen>Convict</fen>.
The <fen>Sentence</fen> is imposed on the <fen>Convict</fen> by the <fen>Court</fen>.
This role denotes the duration of the sentence.
The illegal action of which the <fen>Convict</fen> has been found guilty and for which they are punished.
The Time when the <fen>Convict</fen> is sentenced.
The location of the sentencing <fen>Court</fen>.
The <fen>Executioner</fen> is the individual who performs the execution.
The <fen>Executed</fen> is the person who is killed by the <fen>Executioner</fen> in retribution for the crime that the <fen>Executed</fen> was convicted of.
When the execution occurs.
Where the execution takes place.
The person or sentient entity that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The living entity that dies as a result of the killing.
An inanimate entity or process that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The method or action that the <fen>Killer</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> performs resulting in the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The device used by the <fen>Killer</fen> to bring about the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The point or period of time within which the <fen>Victim</fen> is killed.
The location where the death took place.
The Authority (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the <fen>Finding</fen>.
This role identifies the outcome of the <fen>Authority</fen>'s deliberation or consideration.
This role describes the question on which the <fen>Authority</fen> gives a <fen>Finding</fen>.
The person about whom the <fen>Authority</fen> passes a judgment or <fen>Finding</fen>.
When the Authority gives his <fen>Finding</fen>.
Where the <fen>Finding</fen> takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>John</fex> looked for his pencil.
Leslie examined the glass <fex>for cracks</fex>.
The police were hunting for evidence in my house <fex>yesterday</fex>
<fex>In Paris</fex> police were hunting for suspects in two of the city's southerns suburbs today
Judge Duncan sentenced <fex>Marty</fex> to five years under house detention.
<fex>Judge Duncan</fex> sentenced Marty to five years under house detention.
Judge Duncan sentenced Marty <fex>to five years under house detention</fex>.
Tom will recieve a <t>sentence</t> <fex>of five years</fex>.
A pet store owner was sentenced <fex>for illegaly smuggling protected reptiles</fex>.
He will be sentenced <fex>at a later date</fex>.
Biancaniello will be sentenced <fex>in San Francisco</fex> later this summer.
The truth is, <fex>we</fex> have all put them to death.
<fex>He</fex> was to be hanged in the morning.
<fex>The rockslide</fex> killed nearly half of the climbers.
The flood exterminated the rats <fex>by cutting off access to food</fex>.
It's difficult to suicide <fex>with only a pocketknife</fex>.
There is no evidence that the royal family was killed <fex>during the destruction</fex> at this site.
Apparently there were two murders <fex>in Atherton</fex> in one week.
<fex>The US International Trade Commission</fex> ruled that a 1987 anti-dumping tariff against frozen concentrated orange juice from Brazil could be revoked DNI.
Miss Mahmod's father ruled <fex>that she would never marry him</fex>.
US Supreme Court ruled <fex>on flag salutes in public schools</fex> today.
They held judgment <fex>upon me</fex> as a convicted traitress.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the first 16 years of the century
